Introduction to opendatatoronto

Source: vignettes/opendatatoronto.Rmd
opendatatoronto.Rmd

opendatatoronto is a package for accessing the City of Toronto Open Data portal from within R.

In the portal, datasets are called packages. You can see a list of available packages by using list_packages():

library(opendatatoronto)

packages <- list_packages(limit = 50)

packages
#> # A tibble: 50 x 8
#>    title id    topics excerpt dataset_category formats refresh_rate
#>    <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>            <chr>   <chr>       
#>  1 Chem… ae8e… Envir… This d… Table            WEB,XL… Daily       
#>  2 Apar… 83d5… Locat… This d… Table            CSV,JS… Annually    
#>  3 Immu… 99ff… Health "This … Document         XLSX,C… Annually    
#>  4 Body… c405… City … This d… Table            WEB,CS… Daily       
#>  5 Stre… 1db3… City … Transi… Map              CSV,GE… Semi-annual…
#>  6 Stre… 74f6… City … Public… Map              CSV,GE… Semi-annual…
#>  7 Stre… 821f… City … Public… Map              CSV,GE… Semi-annual…
#>  8 Stre… ccfd… City … Poster… Map              CSV,GE… Semi-annual…
#>  9 Stre… cf70… City … Poster… Map              CSV,GE… Semi-annual…
#> 10 Stre… 99b1… City … Inform… Map              CSV,GE… Semi-annual…
#> # … with 40 more rows, and 1 more variable: num_resources <int>

Or, you can search packages by title using search_packages():

apartment_packages <- search_packages("Apartment")

apartment_packages
#> # A tibble: 2 x 8
#>   title id    topics excerpt dataset_category formats refresh_rate
#>   <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>            <chr>   <chr>       
#> 1 Apar… 83d5… Locat… This d… Table            CSV,JS… Annually    
#> 2 Apar… 2b98… Busin… "This … Table            CSV,JS… Monthly     
#> # … with 1 more variable: num_resources <int>

Within a package, there are a number of resources - e.g. CSV, XSLX, JSON, SHP files, and more. Resources are the actual “data”.

For a given package, you can get a list of resources using list_package_resources():

library(dplyr)

apartment_building_registration_package <- apartment_packages %>%
  filter(title == "Apartment Building Registration")

apartment_building_registration_resources <- apartment_building_registration_package %>%
  list_package_resources()

apartment_building_registration_resources
#> # A tibble: 1 x 4
#>   name                   format id                     last_modified       
#>   <chr>                  <chr>  <chr>                  <chr>               
#> 1 Apartment Building Re… CSV    c2b222e4-4cc0-4683-90… 2019-08-07T14:19:51…

Finally (and most usefully!), you can download the resource (i.e., the actual data) directly into R using get_resource():

apartment_building_registration_data <- apartment_building_registration_resources %>%
  get_resource()

apartment_building_registration_data
#> # A tibble: 3,447 x 37
#>    `_id` AIR_CONDITIONIN… AMENITIES_AVAIL… BALCONIES BARRIER_FREE_AC…
#>    <int> <chr>            <chr>            <chr>     <chr>           
#>  1  3447 CENTRAL AIR      Indoor pool , I… YES       YES             
#>  2  3448 NONE             <NA>             NO        NO              
#>  3  3449 NONE             <NA>             YES       YES             
#>  4  3450 NONE             <NA>             YES       NO              
#>  5  3451 INDIVIDUAL UNITS Indoor recreati… NO        YES             
#>  6  3452 INDIVIDUAL UNITS <NA>             YES       NO              
#>  7  3453 NONE             <NA>             NO        NO              
#>  8  3454 NONE             Indoor recreati… NO        YES             
#>  9  3455 NONE             Indoor exercise… NO        NO              
#> 10  3456 INDIVIDUAL UNITS <NA>             NO        YES             
#> # … with 3,437 more rows, and 32 more variables: BIKE_PARKING <chr>,
#> #   EXTERIOR_FIRE_ESCAPE <chr>, `FACILITIES_AVAILABLE?` <chr>,
#> #   FIRE_ALARM <chr>, GARBAGE_CHUTES <chr>, HEATING_TYPE <chr>,
#> #   INTERCOM <chr>, `IS_THERE_A_COOLING_ROOM?` <chr>,
#> #   `IS_THERE_EMERGENCY_POWER?` <chr>, LAUNDRY_ROOM <chr>,
#> #   LOCKER_OR_STORAGE_ROOM <chr>, NO_BARRIERFREE_ACCESSBLE_UNITS <chr>,
#> #   NO_OF_ACCESSIBLEPARKING_SPACES <chr>, NO_OF_ELEVATORS <chr>,
#> #   NO_OF_STOREYS <int>, NO_OF_UNITS <int>, `NON-SMOKING_BUILDING` <chr>,
#> #   PARKING_TYPE <chr>, PETS_ALLOWED <chr>,
#> #   PROP_MANAGEMENT_COMPANY_NAME <chr>, PROPERTY_TYPE <chr>, RSN <int>,
#> #   SEPARATE_GAS_METERS_EACH_UNIT <chr>,
#> #   SEPARATE_HYDRO_METER_EACH_UNIT <chr>,
#> #   SEPARATE_WATER_METERS_EA_UNIT <chr>, SITE_ADDRESS <chr>,
#> #   SPRINKLER_SYSTEM <chr>, VISITOR_PARKING <chr>, WARD <chr>,
#> #   WINDOW_TYPE <chr>, YEAR_BUILT <chr>, YEAR_REGISTERED <chr>

The opendatatoronto package can currently handle the download of CSV, XLS/XLSX, XML, JSON, SHP, and GeoJSON resources, as well as ZIP resources that contain multiple files. For more information, see the following vignettes:

  • Retrieving multi-sheet XLS/XLSX resources
  • Retrieving multi-file ZIP resources
  • Retrieving multiple resources using purrr
  • Working with spatial data from the portal

Developed by Sharla Gelfand, City of Toronto.
